title: Font used on wrapping paper in How To Lose A Guy In 10 Days
content:
Hi,

I know it's tough to see, but I was wondering if anyone can make out what font is used for the text "i love you" on the gift wrapping paper in this scene from How To Lose A Guy in 10 Days. For the second image, I made the background darker in an attempt to help see the type. Thanks.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416110212im_/http:/typophile.com/files/wrapping-paper-(front)_5086.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416110212im_/http:/typophile.com/files/wrapping-paper-(close-up)_6518.jpg)
author: bfingeroth

comments.content: i know its tough, i just thought someone might just instantly recognize the shapes.

I suspect it's custom. Gift-wrapping paper is often produced by the same companies that make greeting cards, and greeting card companies are possibly the last large-scale employers of handlettering artists.
